News Application Modules¶

This section contains documentation for all modules in the News Application.

Models¶

Models for the news application.

class news.models.Article(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

Model representing a news article.

Articles are created by journalists and require editor approval before being published. They can be associated with a publisher or be independent journalist articles.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

approved_at¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

approved_by¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class news.models.CustomUser(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: AbstractUser

Custom user model with role-based fields. Roles: Reader, Editor, Journalist

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

ROLE_CHOICES = [('reader', 'Reader'), ('editor', 'Editor'), ('journalist', 'Journalist')]¶
affiliated_publishers¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

approved_articles¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class news.models.Newsletter(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

Model representing a newsletter.

Newsletters are content pieces created by journalists that can be sent to subscribers. Similar to articles but designed for periodic distribution.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

class news.models.Publisher(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

Model representing a news publisher organization.

Publishers are news organizations that journalists can be affiliated with and readers can subscribe to for content updates.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

Views¶

Views for the news application.

news.views.article_approve_view(request, pk)[source]¶

Approve an article (editors only).

news.views.article_create_view(request)[source]¶

Create a new article (journalists only).

news.views.article_delete_view(request, pk)[source]¶

Delete an article.

news.views.article_detail_view(request, pk)[source]¶

View a single article.

news.views.article_list_view(request)[source]¶

List all approved articles.

news.views.article_update_view(request, pk)[source]¶

Update an existing article.

news.views.editor_dashboard_view(request)[source]¶

Dashboard for editors to review and approve articles.

news.views.home_view(request)[source]¶

Home page showing approved articles.

news.views.journalist_dashboard_view(request)[source]¶

Dashboard for journalists to manage their articles.

news.views.journalist_profile_view(request, pk)[source]¶

View a journalist’s profile and articles.

news.views.login_view(request)[source]¶

User login view.

news.views.logout_view(request)[source]¶

User logout view.

news.views.publisher_create_view(request)[source]¶

Create a new publisher (editors only).

news.views.publisher_detail_view(request, pk)[source]¶

View a single publisher with their articles.

news.views.publisher_list_view(request)[source]¶

List all publishers.

news.views.reader_dashboard_view(request)[source]¶

Dashboard for readers to manage subscriptions and view articles.

news.views.register_view(request)[source]¶

User registration view.

news.views.toggle_journalist_subscription(request, pk)[source]¶

Toggle subscription to a journalist.

news.views.toggle_publisher_subscription(request, pk)[source]¶

Toggle subscription to a publisher.

Forms¶

Forms for the news application.

class news.forms.ArticleApprovalForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)[source]¶

Bases: ModelForm

Form for editors to approve articles.

Provides a simple checkbox interface for editors to approve or reject pending articles submitted by journalists.

save(commit=True)[source]¶

Save this form’s self.instance object if commit=True. Otherwise, add a save_m2m() method to the form which can be called after the instance is saved manually at a later time. Return the model instance.

API Views¶

API views for the REST API.

class news.api_views.ArticleViewSet(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: ReadOnlyModelViewSet

API endpoint for retrieving articles based on user subscriptions.

Filters articles to only show those from publishers or journalists the authenticated user (reader) is subscribed to.

by_journalist(request)[source]¶

Get articles filtered by a specific journalist. Query param: journalist_id

by_publisher(request)[source]¶

Get articles filtered by a specific publisher. Query param: publisher_id

get_queryset()[source]¶

Filter articles based on the authenticated user’s subscriptions.

Returns: - Articles from publishers the user is subscribed to - Articles from journalists the user is subscribed to - Only approved articles

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>, <class 'news.api_views.IsReaderOrReadOnly'>]¶
serializer_class¶

alias of ArticleSerializer

subscriptions(request)[source]¶

Get information about user’s subscriptions.

class news.api_views.IsReaderOrReadOnly[source]¶

Bases: BasePermission

Custom permission to only allow readers to view articles.

has_permission(request, view)[source]¶

Return True if permission is granted, False otherwise.

Signals¶

Django signals for automated actions when articles are approved.

news.signals.article_approved_actions(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)[source]¶

Trigger automated actions when an article is approved: 1. Send emails to subscribers 2. Post to X (Twitter)

news.signals.post_article_to_twitter(article)[source]¶

Post article announcement to X (Twitter) using the API. Uses Twitter API v2.

news.signals.send_article_to_subscribers(article)[source]¶

Send email notification to all subscribers of the article’s publisher or journalist.

news.signals.track_approval_status(sender, instance, **kwargs)[source]¶

Track when an article’s approval status changes.
